review_title: wish they improved the salary rate more often
job_title: Student Assistant in San Mateo, CA

job_title: Personal Trainer in San Mateo, CA
pros: My position allows for a lot of independence and I can make my own schedule.
cons: Communication isn't great between management and staff.

review_title: Important mission and dedicated, friendly coworkers
job_title: Senior Software Developer/Analyst in San Mateo, CA
pros: The mission of the district is inspiring. The people who work here are dedicated to the mission and the culture is friendly and supportive. Benefits are excellent, including defined benefit pension plans. There is beautiful on-campus housing for employees, with rents that are reasonable for this area. Top leadership is very good.
cons: For highly skilled people in IT, salaries are relatively low compared to other employers in this high-cost-of-living area. However, salaries are decent for less-skilled employees, and I like working for an organization that avoids exploiting people. There is a waiting list for on-campus housing and one must move out after seven years there.

job_title: Student Mentor in Redwood City, CA
pros: Very fun and engaging work environment. Loved being able to guide other students through their academic journey.
cons: Our supervisor had to move midway and it caused a lot of disruption. But its more a of a temporary con.

job_title: Student Assistant in Redwood City, CA

review_title: Not a good fit - too political.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Mateo, CA
pros: Good pay and benefits, including including substantial vacation and holiday time off.  I enjoyed working to promote affordable educational opportunities.
cons: The culture is very political and bureaucratic.  There can be a lot of infighting between departments, and a "District vs Campus" mentality on both sides.  Funding for Community Colleges is very poor.  This isn't the District's fault, but it does lead to a rather depressing work environment when you are constantly cutting with no opportunity for growth.

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in San Bruno, CA
pros: Beautiful campus, hardworking and inspirational students, engaging and progressive faculty, and warm staff.
cons: Limited training and mentorship for new employees (specifically the Learning Center while I was there). I would have appreciated a more structured orientation process, as well as routine check-ins and continued support over the year.

job_title: Programmer Analyst in San Mateo, CA
pros: Great benefits, little stress, interesting projects, great working with students and education professionals developing the next generation of professionals
cons:
Government doesn't pay very well
Can be bureaucratic
Shared governance takes some getting used to

review_title: Great Opportunity to gain experience in the IT field
